error.signature: RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration
error.regex: RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration

verdict.summary: Modifying a dict while iterating over it. Also applies to sets.

dead_ends.action: Use try/except RuntimeError to catch and continue
dead_ends.why_fails: Silences the error but iteration results are undefined

dead_ends.action: Switch to a different dict implementation
dead_ends.why_fails: All Python dicts have this restriction

workarounds.action: Iterate over a copy: for k in list(d.keys()): del d[k]
Build a new dict with dict comprehension instead of modifying in place
workarounds.how: filtered = {k: v for k, v in d.items() if condition}
